intro: Cryptantha coryi, commonly known as the Sierra cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, clustered blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions, preferring full sun. Its small, oval-shaped leaves are arranged in pairs along the stems. Cryptantha coryi is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to survive in arid environments.
